original_title: Attempts being made to demolish 400-year-old building -Unions
original_body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); Trade unions have alleged that authorities are attempting to demolish a Dutch-era building of archaeological importance, near the Colombo harbor, arbitrarily.
General Secretary of the All Ceylon General Port Employees Union Niroshan Gorakanage said the building is over 400 years old.
The two-storey building with underground rooms was used by the Dutch as an administrative center and a detention center for prisoners.
Gorakanage said the building was also included in paintings drawn in 1687, and became popular as the Secretariat building.
Gorakanage claimed the decision to demolish the building was reached by the Road Development Authority and the Sri Lanka Ports Authority, in order to facilitate the elevated highway.
He said several requests were made to the subject Minister and the Commisioner of Archaeology to safeguard the building, adding however they have failed to respond.
Niroshan Gorakanage added that trade unions will stand against attempts to demolish the building.
When inquired by News 1st Director General of Archaeology, Dr. Pradeepa Serasinghe said they have no information stating that a Dutch-era building near the port will be demolished.
She added however special attention has been directed towards the archaeological monuments at the port.
